title: What's the difference between 'suppose' and 'think' in passive voice? - Quora

response.answer_text: To suppose something often is to suggest a possible answer, almost like “It was considered possible…” or “It was considered likely.” (A separate use of “supposed” is used in “The bus was supposed tom be here 5 minutes ago.” This means that it was expected to appear then.) Thought is a little stronger than supposed. “It was thought…” usually means that “Most people believed…” for example, “ Before Copernicus, it was thought that the world was flat.” On the other hand, “It was supposed…” means that “Some people believed….” This is a lot like “Some people proposed the idea that….”

“Thought” indicates a stronger belief than “supposed”, e.g. It was thought for centuries that the Sun went round the Earth. It was supposed by many that the Beatles would get together again for an anniversary album, but it never happened.
